page.title: 15Gnosall Police Station
page.content: There are 6 police constables and a segeant in charge at Gnosall. Vandalism is the most common crime and young people between the ages of 12 and 20 years are usually responsible. When vandals are caught the police either give a caution or start court action. Gnosall police believe that it is important to get to know all the people living on their "beat", and to try to help them with their problems. Not all of their work is done in uniform. The police do periods of time with the C.I.D. when they wear leisure clothes. The village policemen get called out about 6 times a day, an average of about 40 times a week. One of the areas to be investigated by police in the Gnosall area is complaints about cruelty to farm animals.
